definition: (indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: The car must break down just when we were about to start off.
sentences.chinese: 我們正要出發時偏偏車又壞了。

sentences.english: But Fate does iron wedges drive.
But Wenfeng Pagoda was built in violation of that rule.
sentences.chinese: 可文峯塔偏偏違反了這個規律。

sentences.english: I met my ex in a Weight Watchers meeting, of all places.
sentences.chinese: 我和前女友偏偏是在一家減肥中心相識的。

sentences.english: Yet the last apple fallen from the tree is usually sour.
sentences.chinese: 偏偏最後掉下的紅蘋果，通常是酸的。

sentences.english: Front she were placed in pot inside and half alive half dead, and now it becomes like a lady.
sentences.chinese: 前面被燙的要死要活的，現在倒是像一個偏偏淑女了。

sentences.english: Why did it have to be me?
Did ever dragon keep so fair a cave?
sentences.chinese: 可怕的毒龍偏偏守着這麼一個可愛的仙洞？

sentences.english: You don't like to take risks, and Sagittarians thrive on chance.
sentences.chinese: 你不喜歡冒險，偏偏這是射手座最鐘意的。

sentences.english: But the day does not hope from the human, let him become the deaf person.
sentences.chinese: 但天不從人願，偏偏讓他成了聾人。

sentences.english: I happened to be out when he came to visit me.
sentences.chinese: 他來看我，偏偏我不在家。

sentences.english: The machine must break down at this busy hour.
sentences.chinese: 正忙的時候，機器偏偏又壞了。

sentences.english: And he knew that it was mine.
sentences.chinese: 偏偏他明知道那是我的。

sentences.english: Why did you borrow the book when you had one?
sentences.chinese: 這本書你有一本，爲什麼偏偏還借呢？

sentences.english: Yet the last apple fallen from the tree is routinely sour.
sentences.chinese: 偏偏最後掉下的紅蘋果，嗵常是酸的。

sentences.english: Why do you like to work in our company among many other companies?
sentences.chinese: 有這麼多公司，你爲什麼偏偏喜歡來本公司工作？

definition: to insist on doing sth/must do it, despite everything
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
to want absolutely/to insist on (doing something)
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
